calculatedValues.name: cvTreatmentType
calculatedValues.expression: iif({TreatmentStatusType} contains 'TIEBACK', 'Treatment: TIEBACK', iif({TreatmentStatusType} contains 'BVEAP', 'Treatment: BVEAP', iif({TreatmentStatusType} contains 'STENT', 'Treatment: STENT', iif({TreatmentStatusType} contains 'ARYTENOIDECTOMY', 'Treatment: ARYTENOIDECTOMY', iif({TreatmentStatusType} contains 'VENTRILOCORDECTOMY', 'Treatment: VENTRILOCORDECTOMY', ''))

calculatedValues.name: cvObserveFirstPersonPast
calculatedValues.expression: iif({LifeStatus} = true, 'did you observe', 'have you observed')

calculatedValues.name: cvEndOfLife
calculatedValues.expression: iif({LifeStatus} = true, 'towards the end of {genderObjectPronoun} life', 'in {genderObjectPronoun} current state of health')

elements.name: cvTreatmentType
elements.html: Treatment type = {cvTreatmentType}

elements.html: cvLvngCmpnAgeTotalMonths = {cvLvngCmpnAgeTotalMonths}

elements.name: cvDcsdCmpnAgeTotalMonths
elements.html: cvDcsdCmpnAgeTotalMonths = {cvDcsdCmpnAgeTotalMonths}

elements.name: cvAgeInMonths
elements.html: cvAgeInMonths = {cvAgeInMonths}

elements.name: cvAgeInMonthsAtSymptomOnset
elements.html: cvAgeInMonthsAtSymptomOnset = {cvAgeInMonthsAtSymptomOnset}

elements.name: cvDurationOfSymptomsInMonths
elements.html: cvDurationOfSymptomsInMonths = {cvDurationOfSymptomsInMonths}

elements.name: LandingVersion
elements.html:
LarParLife.org LP/GOLPP Survey
Beta 0.9/26.02.12.01

elements.name: LandingTitleHead
elements.html:
LP/GOLPP Survey 2026

Presented by LarParLife.org

elements.name: LandingIntroText01
elements.html: You're here because the disease of laryngeal paralysis (LarPar, LP) or Geriatric-Onset Laryngeal Paralysis and Polyneuropathy (GOLPP) has touched your life.

elements.name: LandingIntroText
elements.html: At the beginning of their LP/GOLPP journey, people often have more questions than answers. This survey has two modes: Survey Mode and Workbook Mode. Which mode you choose depends on how far long on your LP/GOLPP journey you are:

elements.name: LandingIntroText02
elements.html:
• Survey Mode collects information from people who are not new to the LP/GOLPP journey. If you want to share your experience, select Survey Mode.
  • In Workbook Mode you can browse the survey questions without making selections to help you learn about the choices you'll need to make as you move forward on your LP/GOLPP journey. If you're new to LP/GOLPP, select Workbook Mode

elements.name: LandingJourneyText
elements.html: In Survey Mode you'll be asked to remember details about your LP/GOLPP journey. If you find yourself answering 'Don't know' to many of the questions, you can switch to Workbook Mode to refresh your memory and continue later.

elements.name: LandingLosingCompanion
elements.html: We know how hard it is to lose one's beloved companion. If your companion has recently crossed over the Rainbow Bridge, maybe it's best to do the survey later when you've had time to heal.

elements.name: LandingAboutPrivacyHeading
elements.html: About your privacy and personal information

elements.name: LandingAboutPrivacyText01
elements.html: We're not asking for your last name, so we have no way to connect you with any of your private data. We need only four pieces of information to verify survey results:

elements.name: LandingAboutPrivacyText02
elements.html:
• Your first name
  • Your companion animal's name
  • The country in which you live
  • Your email address or Facebook account name

elements.name: LandingAboutPrivacyText02
elements.html: This information ensures that all the survey respondents are unique and verifiable without making them identifiable outside the context of the survey. For details about how we'll use the data we collect and further steps we'll take to anonymize your contact information, select the 'About your privacy' and 'Consent information' links.

elements.name: LandingPrivacy
elements.html: About Your Privacy

elements.name: LandingData
elements.html: About Your Consent?

elements.name: LandingConsentHeading
elements.html: By clicking the checkbox below, you confirm that you're ready to answer questions about your LP companion and consent to the terms of our privacy and consent statements.

elements.name: LandingConsent
elements.title: Do you agree to the terms and conditions?

elements.name: UserInfoLifeStatusHeading
elements.html: Before We Begin

elements.name: UserInfoLifeStatusText
elements.html:
We know how hard it is to lose one's beloved companion animal. If you're still grieving from the loss, maybe it's best to do the survey later when you've had time to heal.

If you'd like to continue now, now please tell us your LP companion's name and if they have crossed over the Rainbow Bridge. This will help us avoid questions that are inappropriate for your situation.

elements.name: CmpnName
elements.title: Please tell us your companion's name:

elements.name: LifeStatus
elements.title: Has {CmpnName} crossed over the Rainbow Bridge?

elements.name: UserInfoHeading
elements.html: About You

elements.name: UserInfoText
elements.html: We're asking for your first name, which country you live in, and some optional demographics to help us understand the people who are making choices for their beloved LP companions. We also ask for contact info to prevent fake respondents and make sure each respondent is unique and verifiable.

elements.name: UserInfoVerificationHeading
elements.html: Verification Contact

elements.name: UserInfoVerificationPanelText
elements.html:
We contact a random sample of respondents for verification purposes. You may or may not be contacted. You can provide an email address or, if you're more comfortable communicating via Facebook Messenger, you can provide your Facebook account name.

With your consent, we may also contact you to talk in more detail about your experience with LP.

elements.name: UserInfoContactType
elements.title: Would you like to use email or Facebook Messenger for verification?
Email address:
elements.name: UserInfoContactTypeEmail
UserInfoContactTypeFacebookInstructions
elements.title: z
elements.html: Please go to your Facebook account page and copy the URL, then paste it below. Example: https://facebook.com/my.user.name.

elements.title: Facebook account:
elements.name: UserInfoContactTypeFacebook

validators.text: Please enter a valid Facebook profile URL, e.g., https://facebook.com/your.username

elements.name: UserInfoContactOK
elements.title: May we contact you to talk more about your LP experience?

elements.name: UserInfoAboutPanel
elements.title: Your First Name and Country
First Name:
elements.name: UserInfoFirstName
UserInfoCountry
elements.title: Country:

elements.name: UserInfoStateRegion
elements.title: State, province or region (optional):

elements.name: UserInfoAgeGenderPanel
elements.title: Age and Gender (optional)

elements.name: UserInfoAgeGenderText
elements.html: We're asking for basic demographic information to help understand how different people manage the animals in their care.

elements.name: UserInfoAgeGroup
elements.title: Approximately what is your age?

elements.name: UserInfoGender
elements.title: Gender information:

elements.name: CmpnInfoHeading
elements.html: <h3>About your LP/GOLPP companion<h3>

elements.name: CmpnInfoText
elements.html: This section asks basic questions about your companion's species, age, breed, weight, and demeanor. The answers are required to continue with the survey. If you don't know exact information, it's OK to guesstimate.

elements.name: CmpnInfoAnimalType
elements.title: {CmpnName}'s species:

elements.name: CmpnInfoBreed
elements.title: {CmpnName}'s breed or mix:

elements.name: CmpnInfoGender
elements.title: {CmpnName}'s gender:

elements.name: CmpnInfoWeight
elements.title: {CmpnName}'s last known weight (in lbs or kg):
elements.description: Please enter a number

elements.name: CmpnInfoWeightUnits
elements.title: Weight units:
elements.description: Please choose pounds or kilos.

elements.name: dcsdCmpnInfoAgePanel
elements.title: At about what age did {CmpnName} cross over the Rainbow Bridge?
elements.description: Please enter years and months

elements.name: dcsdCmpnInfoAgeYears
elements.title: Age in years (number):

elements.name: dcsdCmpnInfoAgeMonths
elements.title: Months (number 1 - 12)

elements.name: lvngCmpnInfoAgePanel
elements.title: What is {CmpnName}'s approximate age (in years and months)?

elements.name: lvngCmpnInfoAgeYears
elements.title: Age in years (number):

elements.name: lvngCmpnInfoAgeMonths
elements.title: Months (number 1 - 12)

elements.name: CmpnInfoDemeanor
elements.title: How would you describe {CmpnName}'s demeanor?
elements.description: 1 = very calm, 5 = very energetic

elements.name: CmpnInfoAnxiety
elements.title: How would you describe {CmpnName}'s anxiety level?
elements.description: 1 = not at all anxious, 5 = very anxious

elements.name: lvngCmpnInfoHasInsurance
elements.title: {cvDoFirstPersonSingularInitialCap} you have pet insurance for {CmpnName}?

elements.name: InfoSourcesHeading
elements.html: How did you learn about LP/GOLPP?

elements.name: InfoSourcesText
elements.html: This section asks some questions about how you learned about laryngeal paralysis and geriatric-onset laryngeal paralysis (LP) and polyneuropathy (GOLPP) and whether the information you found helped you make decisions for {CmpnName}. There is no right or wrong answer, so please answer as best as you can without thinking too hard about it.

elements.name: InfoSourcesPriorKnowledge
elements.title: Had you ever heard of LP before {CmpnName} got it?

elements.name: InfoSourcesTypes
elements.title: Which sources of information have you accessed to learn about LP?

choices.text: Reddit, X (Twitter), or other social media

elements.name: InfoSourcesBestSource
elements.title: Which of those information sources did you find MOST useful (please select one)?

elements.name: InfoSourcesHardToUnderstand
elements.title: Did you find the information you got about LP difficult to understand?
elements.description: 1 = no, not difficult at all, 5 = very difficult

elements.name: InfoSourcesContradictory
elements.title: Do you feel like a lot of the information you got about LP was contradictory?
elements.description: 1 = not at all contradictory, 5 = very contradictory

elements.name: InfoSourcesClearAnswers
elements.title: Did you find it hard to get clear answers to your questions so you could make informed choices for {CmpnName}?
elements.description: 1 = No, not hard at all, 5 = yes, very hard

elements.name: IntubationHistoryHeading
elements.html: Intubation History

elements.name: IntubationHistoryText
elements.html: This section asks about {CmpnName}'s intubation history in the 12 months prior to LP/GOLPP symptoms.

elements.name: IntubationHistoryWasIntubated
elements.title: Had {CmpnName} been intubated under anesthesia for any reason in the 12 months prior to the first LP symptoms?

elements.name: IntubationHistoryReason
elements.title: For what reason or reasons was {CmpnName} intubated prior to the first LP symptoms appearing?

elements.name: IntubationHistoryConcerns
elements.title: Do you remember having any concerns about how the intubation/anesthesia affected {CmpnName}?

elements.name: IntubationHistorySymptoms
elements.title: What symptoms did {CmpnName} have after the intubation/anesthesia?

elements.name: BreathingCrisis
elements.html: LP Breathing Crisis

elements.name: BreathingCrisisText
elements.html: In a breathing crisis, the paralyzed arytenoid cartilages block the airway and cut off airflow to the lungs. In extreme cases, the crisis escalates into a breathing emergency that requires care at a veterinary facility to restore breathing. These questions are about breathing emergencies that required care from a licensed veterinarian.

elements.name: BreathingCrisisDidHave
elements.title: Did {CmpnName} ever have a breathing crisis that required an emergency visit to a veterinary professional?

elements.name: BreathingCrisisCount
elements.title: How many times did {CmpnName} visit a veterinary professional due to an LP/GOLPP-associated breathing crisis?

elements.name: BreathingCrisisCost
elements.title: About what was the total pre-insurance cost of these visits?

choices.text: Don't know or prefer not to say

elements.name: BreathingCrisisAdvice
elements.title: Did a veterinary professional give you any advice on how to deal with an LP-induced breathing emergency/crisis?

elements.name: BreathingCrisisAdviceType
elements.title: What advice did they give you to help you deal with a breathing crisis?

choices.text: Get them to a cool place
Apply ice, a cooling vest, or some other cooling agent
Bring them to an emergency facility immediately

elements.name: BreathingCrisisProvidedSubstance
elements.title: Did a veterinary professional provide you with a substance or product to help deal with an LP/GOLPP-induced breathing emergency/crisis?

elements.name: BreathingCrisisProvidedSubstanceType
elements.title: What substance or product did they provide?

elements.name: BreathingCrisisSubstanceForm
elements.title: In what form was the sedative or steriod provided?

elements.name: EarlySymptomsHeading
elements.html: Your early encounters with LP/GOLPP

elements.name: EarlySymptomsText
elements.html: Most people know something's wrong with their companion before they know it's LP or even before they know there is such a thing as LP. This section asks questions about the early phase of your LP/GOLPP journey and how you came to believe {CmpnName} might have it.

elements.name: EarlySymptomsFirstSignsPanel
elements.title: About how old was {CmpnName} (in years and months) when you first noticed symptoms of LP/GOLPP?

elements.name: EarlySymptomsAgeYears
elements.title: Years

elements.name: EarlySymptomsAgeMonths
elements.title: Months (number 1 - 12)

elements.name: EarlySymptomsType
elements.title: What symptoms did {CmpnName} have at that time?

elements.name: EarlySymtomsSeverity
elements.title: How severe did you think {CmpnName}'s early symptoms were?
elements.description: 1 = mild, 5 = severe

elements.name: EarlySymptomsHindEndWeakness
elements.title: Was {CmpnName} already showing signs of hind-end weakness in this early stage?

elements.name: EarlySymptomsIncontinence
elements.title: Was {CmpnName} already showing signs of urinary or fecal incontinence weakness in this early stage?

elements.name: EarlyOtherConditions
elements.title: When {CmpnName} first started showing symptoms of LP, did he have any other health conditions?

elements.name: EarlyOtherConditionsType
elements.title: Which other conditions did {CmpnName} have when the first LP symptoms appeared?

elements.name: PrimaryDurationHeading
elements.html: Duration of care by primary veterinarians for LP/GOLPP symptoms

elements.name: PrimaryDurationText
elements.html: This section asks about the duration of {CmpnName}'s care by primary veterinarians for LP/GOLPP symptoms. This includes any primary veterinarians who saw {CmpnName} since the LP/GOLPP symptoms first appeared. It also asks whether you switched primary vets because of how {CmpnName}'s symptoms were being handled.

elements.name: PrimaryDurationFirstConsult
elements.title: About how old was {CmpnName} when you first consulted with a primary veterinarian about LP/GOLPP symptoms?

elements.name: PrimaryDurationFirstConsultYears
elements.title: Age in years (number):

elements.name: PrimaryDurationFirstConsultMonths
elements.title: Months (number 0 - 12)

elements.name: PrimaryDurationVisitsNumber
elements.title: About how many times did a primary veterinarian see {CmpnName} about LP/GOLPP symptoms?

elements.name: PrimaryDurationCost
elements.title: About what was the total pre-insurance cost of these visits to primary veterinarians about {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP symptoms?

choices.text: Don't know or prefer not to say

elements.name: PrimaryDurationChangedVets
elements.title: Did you ever change primary veterinarians because how they handled {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP symptoms?

elements.name: PrimaryDurationChangedVetsReason
elements.title: Why did you change veterinarians after {CmpnName} started showing symptoms of LP/GOLPP?
elements.description: Please check all that apply.

choices.text: The previous vet said nothing could be done about {CmpnName}'s symptoms.
The previous vet couldn't give possible causes for {CmpnName}'s symptoms.
The previous vet said {CmpnName}'s symptoms were just due to age.
The previous vet ordered tests that I didn't think were relevant.

elements.name: PrimaryVetHeading
elements.html: Your primary veterinarian and {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP

elements.name: PrimaryVetText
elements.html:
This section asks questions about your primary veterinarian's handling of {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP symptoms.

If you changed primary vets since {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP symptoms first appeared , please answer the question about your preferred or most recent primary veterinarian.

elements.name: PrimaryVetInflammation
elements.title: Did your primary veterinarian observe any inflammation, irritation, or infection in the larynx/pharynx area?

elements.name: PrimaryVetReflux
elements.title: Did your primary veterinarian mention reflux (GERD) or esophageal dysfunction as a possible cause of {CmpnName}'s symptoms?

elements.name: PrimaryVetRefluxMeds
elements.title: Did your primary veterinarian prescribe or recommend a reflux medication such as Pepcid (famotadine) or Prilosec (omeprazole) for reflux?

elements.name: PrimaryVetRefluxInitiative
elements.title: Did you start {CmpnName} on reflux medications such as Pepcid (famotadine) or Prilosec (omeprazole) on your own intiative without a prescription or recommendation from your primary vet?

elements.name: PrimaryVetDiagnosis
elements.title: Did your primary vet discuss LP/GOLPP as a possible cause of {CmpnName}'s symptoms?

choices.text: No, did not mention LP/GOLPP at all
Said {CmpnName}'s symptoms were possibly due to LP/GOLPP
Said {CmpnName}'s symptoms were definitely due to LP/GOLPP

elements.name: PrimaryVetInfoDidGive
elements.title: Did your current primary veterinarian give you helpful information about how LP/GOLPP might affect {CmpnName}?

elements.name: PrimaryVetInfoDetails
elements.title: What did they tell you about the how LP/GOLPP might affect {CmpnName}?

elements.name: PrimaryVetSurgery
elements.title: Did your primary veterinarian make a recommendation about tieback or other LP/GOLPP surgeries for {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP?

choices.text: Encouraged me to talk to a surgeon

elements.name: PrimaryVetSurgeryPerception
elements.title: Do you feel like your primary veterinarian's recommendation against surgery was due to {CmpnName}'s condition or to a generally negative perception of tieback surgery?

elements.name: PrimaryVetConfidence
elements.title: How confident have you been you in your current primary veterinarian's knowledge level regarding LP/GOLPP?
elements.description: 1 = not at all confident, 5 = very confident

elements.name: PrimaryVetSatisfaction
elements.title: How satisfied have you been with your current primary veterinarian's handling of {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP?
elements.description: 1 = not at all satisfied, 5 = very satisfied

elements.name: DiagnosisHeading
elements.html: {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP diagnosis

elements.name: DiagnosisText
elements.html:
This section asks who provided {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP diagnosis and what diagnostic procedures they used to arrive at their conclusion.

You may have seen multiple vets about {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP symptoms. Please answer the question about the vet who provided the definitive diagnosis, i.e., the one you used to make decisions about {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP.

elements.name: DiagnosisWho
elements.title: Which veterinary professional provided you with the definitive LP/GOLPP diagnosis:

elements.name: DiagnosticType
elements.title: What diagnostic procedure was used to arrive at the definitive diagnosis?

choices.text: Video endoscope or laryngoscope under anesthesia

elements.name: DiagnosisStage
elements.title: Was {CmpnName} diagnosed with unilateral or bilateral LP?

choices.text: I wasn't told what stage {CmpnName}'s LP was in

elements.name: DiagnosisTimeAfterSymptoms
elements.title: About how long after {CmpnName}'s first symptoms appeared did you get the diagnosis?:

choices.text: Between six months and a year

elements.name: DiagnosisCost
elements.title: What was the pre-insurance cost of the diagnosis?

choices.text: Don't know or prefer not to say

elements.name: DiagnosisSurgeonContingent
elements.title: Did the surgeon require consent to proceed with the surgery before doing the diagnosis?
elements.description: In other words, did the surgeon refuse to do the diagnosis unless you agreed to go straight to surgery if the results were positive?

choices.text: Yes, required surgery consent before diagnosis
No, did not require surgery consent for diagnosis

elements.name: TreatmentStatusHeading
elements.html: Veterinary-Medical Procedures

elements.name: TreatmentStatusText
elements.html: This section asks questions about any surgery or implant procedure {CmpnName} underwent to treat LP/GOLPP symptoms. This only includes surgeries or procedures that diriectly modify the structure of the larynx.

elements.name: TreatmentStatusDidHave
elements.title: Did {CmpnName} undergo a veterinary-medical procedure such as surgery or a stent implant for LP/GOLPP?

elements.name: TreatmentStatusAgePanel
elements.title: At about what age did {CmpnName} have the first surgery or stent procedure?
elements.description: If you can't remember exactly, it's OK to guesstimate.

elements.name: TreatmentStatusAgeYears
elements.title: Age (years)

elements.name: TreatmentStatusAgeMonths
elements.title: Age (months)

elements.name: TreatmentStatusType
elements.title: What kind procedure or procedures did {CmpnName} have?
elements.description: Please check all that apply.

choices.text: BVEAP (Bilateral Vocal Fold Excision & Arytenoid Pexy)

elements.name: TreatmentStatusTiebackPanel
elements.title: Questions about tieback (Unilateral Arytenoid Lateralization) surgery

elements.name: TreatmentStatusTiebackEmergency
elements.title: Was emergency tieback performed on {CmpnName} after a life-threatening breathing emergency?

elements.name: TreatmentStatusTiebackWait
elements.title: How long did you have to wait for non-emergency tieback surgery for {CmpnName}:

elements.name: TreatmentStatusTiebackCount
elements.title: How many times did {CmpnName} undergo tieback (UAL) surgery?

elements.name: TreatmentStatusTiebackOnceCost
elements.title: Approximate cost of surgery (not including post-op complications):
elements.description: Please provide the pre-insurance cost, not the out-of-pocket cost.

elements.name: TreatmentStatusTiebackMultipleCost
elements.title: Approximate total cost of surgeries (not including post-op complications):
elements.description: Please provide the pre-insurance cost, not the out-of-pocket cost.

elements.name: TreatmentStatusTiebackComplications
elements.title: Were there unexpected post-operative complications that required at least one extra night of inpatient care?

elements.name: TreatmentStatusTiebackComplicationsCost
elements.title: Approximate cost of post-operative complications, not including the cost of the surgery:
elements.description: Please provide the pre-insurance cost, not the out-of-pocket cost.

elements.name: TreatmentStatusBveapPanel
elements.title: Questions about BVEAP (Bilateral Vocal Fold Excision & Arytenoid Pexy)

elements.name: TreatmentStatusBveapReasons
elements.title: Why did you choose BVEAP over other surgery types?
elements.description: Please choose all that apply.

choices.text: No risk of suture failure as with tieback surgery

elements.name: TreatmentStatusBveapCost
elements.title: Approximate cost of BVEAP surgery (not including post-op complications):
elements.description: Please provide the pre-insurance cost, not the out-of-pocket cost.

elements.name: TreatmentStatusBveapComplications
elements.title: Were there unexpected post-operative complications that required at least one extra night of inpatient care?

elements.name: TreatmentStatusBveapComplicationsCost
elements.title: Approximate cost of post-operative complications, not including the cost of the surgery:
elements.description: Please provide the pre-insurance cost, not the out-of-pocket cost.

elements.name: TreatmentStatusStentType
elements.title: What type of stent implant did {CmpnName} receive?

elements.name: TreatmentStatusDexstentText
elements.html: IMPORTANT: The Dextronix DexStent LE Nitinol wire stent device has been discontinued by the manufacturer. Report parties involved in the sale or use of this device to your local veterinary regulatory agency.

elements.name: TreatmentStatusStentDidMigrate
elements.title: After the initial implant procedure, did {CmpnName} cough out the stent or did it migrate out of position?

elements.name: TreatmentStatusStentReplaced
elements.title: After the first stent implant migrated or was coughed out, did you have it replaced with another stent?

elements.name: TreatmentStatusStentCostOnce
elements.title: Approximate cost of stent implant procedure, not including complications:
elements.description: Please provide the pre-insurance cost, not the out-of-pocket cost.

elements.name: TreatmentStatusStentCostRepeat
elements.title: Approximate cost of the stent procedures, not including complications:
elements.description: Please provide the pre-insurance cost, not the out-of-pocket cost.

elements.name: TreatmentStatusStentComplications
elements.title: Were there post-operative complications that required overnight inpatient care for {CmpnName}?

elements.name: TreatmentStatusStentComplicationsCost
elements.title: Approximate cost of post-procedure complications, not including the cost of the stent implant procedure:

elements.name: TreatmentStatusArytenoidectomyPanel
elements.title: Questions about partial arytenoidectomy surgery
elements.description: Partial arytenoidectomy is the surgical removal of a section of one of the arytenoid (laryngeal) cartilages.

elements.name: TreatmentStatusArytenoidectomyReasons
elements.title: Why did you choose partial arytenoidectomy over other surgery types?
elements.description: Please choose all that apply.

choices.text: Cost of this surgery compared to other surgery types

elements.name: TreatmentStatusArytenoidectomyLaser
elements.title: Was the partial arytenoidectomy performed with a laser?
elements.description: This technique is called 'ablation'.

elements.name: TreatmentStatusArytenoidectomyDidExplain
elements.title: Did the surgeon explain the pros and cons of this surgery type vs standard tieback surgery?

elements.name: TreatmentStatusArytenoidectomyChoice
elements.title: Did the surgeon offer you the choice between this surgery type and standard tieback surgery?

elements.name: TreatmentStatusArytenoidectomyCost
elements.title: Approximate cost of the partial arytenoidectomy (not including post-op complications):
elements.description: Please provide the pre-insurance cost, not the out-of-pocket cost.

elements.name: TreatmentStatusArytenoidectomyComplications
elements.title: Were there unexpected post-operative complications that required at least one extra night of inpatient care?

elements.name: TreatmentStatusArytenoidectomyComplicationsCost
elements.title: Approximate cost of post-operative complications, not including the cost of the surgery:
elements.description: Please provide the pre-insurance cost, not the out-of-pocket cost.

elements.name: TreatmentStatusVentrilocordectomyPanel
elements.title: Questions about ventrilocordectomy surgery
elements.description: Ventrilocordectomy is the surgical removal of the vocal folds (vocal cords) that dogs use to bark.

elements.name: TreatmentStatusVentrilocordectomyReasons
elements.title: Why did you choose ventrilocordectomy over other surgery types?
elements.description: Please choose all that apply.

choices.text: Cost of this surgery compared to other surgery types

elements.name: TreatmentStatusVentrilocordectomyDidExplain
elements.title: Did the surgeon explain the pros and cons of this surgery type vs tieback surgery?

elements.name: TreatmentStatusVentrilocordectomyChoice
elements.title: Did the surgeon offer you the choice between this surgery type and standard tieback surgery?

elements.name: TreatmentStatusVentrilocordectomyCost
elements.title: Approximate cost of the ventrilocordectomy (not including post-op complications):
elements.description: Please provide the pre-insurance cost, not the out-of-pocket cost.

elements.name: TreatmentStatusVentrilocordectomyComplications
elements.title: Were there unexpected post-operative complications that required at least one extra night of inpatient care?

elements.name: TreatmentStatusVentrilocordectomyComplicationsCost
elements.title: Approximate cost of post-operative complications, not including the cost of the surgery:
elements.description: Please provide the pre-insurance cost, not the out-of-pocket cost.

elements.name: TreatmentStatusSurgeonInformLevel
elements.title: How satisfied were you with the information the surgeon provided to you about the risks and possible complications of the procedure??
elements.description: 1 = very unsatisfied, 5 = very satisfied

elements.name: TreatmentStatusTreatmentSatisfactionLevel
elements.title: How satisfied were you with the results of the procedure?
elements.description: 1 = very unsatisfied, 5 = very satisfied

elements.name: TreatmentFactorsHeading
elements.html: Factors that have influenced your LP/GOLPP decisions

elements.name: TreatmentFactorsDecision
elements.title: Have you made a decision about whether or not to pursue LP surgery such as tieback for {CmpnName}?

choices.text: We will pursue LP surgery such as tieback.
We've decided not to pursue LP surgery.

elements.name: TreatmentFactorsDecisionStent
elements.title: If a veterinarian were to offer a stent implant for LP/GOLPP in your area, would you explore that as a surgery alternative?

choices.text: Yes, we would consider a stent implant.
No, we would not consider a stent implant.

elements.name: TreatmentFactorsDetailsText
elements.html: Please rate the relevant factors in your decision whether or not to pursue tieback or other LP/GOLPP surgery.

elements.name: ManagementHeading
elements.html: Medical managment of LP/GOLPP

elements.name: ManagementText
elements.html: IMPORTANT: Attempting to manage LP/GOLPP symptoms with medications is controversial. There is no medication that can restore movement to paralyzed laryneal tissue. That means that even with medication, the risk of breathing crises and a potentially fatal suffocation event is very real. So while medications can't prevent a breathing emergency, many veterinary professionals believe some medications can have a positive effect on symptoms and improve an LP/GOLPP patient's quality of life.

elements.name: ManagementText
elements.html: Medications for arthritis/osteoarthritis pain such as NSAIDS (Rimadyl, carprofen) and NGF blockers (Librela, Beransa) may improve mobility by reducing pain, but they aren't specifically prescribed for LP/GOLPP and therefore and aren't included in the 'Medical management' section of the survey.

elements.name: OTCProductsHeading
elements.html: OTC (Over-The-Counter) Products for LP/GOLPP

elements.name: OTCProductsText
elements.html:
IMPORTANT: Attempting to manage LP/GOLPP symptoms with supplements and OTC products is controversial. There are no supplements or OTC products that will restore movement to paralyzed laryneal tissue. That means that even with such products, the risk of breathing crises and a potentially fatal suffocation event is very real. While supplements and OTC products can't prevent a breathing emergency, some veterinary professionals believe some supplements and OTC products may have a positive effect on symptoms and improve an LP/GOLPP patient's quality of life.

The questions in this section pertain to the main ingredient of a product, not any specific product. This survey isn't intended to advertise for, recommend, or be used as a marketing vehicle for any specific product. For questions about the effectiveness or safety of any product, consult with a licensed veterinarian.

elements.name: OTCProductsDidPurchase
elements.title: Have you purchased OTC products based on a particular ingredient {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP symptoms?
elements.description: Please only include products you've used regularly for over 60 days

elements.name: AspirationHeading
elements.html: {CmpnName}'s experience with aspiration pneumonia

elements.name: AspirationText
elements.html: Aspiration pneumonia (AP) is the most common and most serious direct complication of LP/GOLPP. This sections asks questions about {CmpnName}'s experience with AP.

elements.name: LandingData
elements.html: What is aspiration pneumonia as why is it a frequent complication of LP/GOLPP ?

elements.name: AspirationCount
elements.title: How many times did {CmpnName} get AP?

elements.name: AspirationInpatient
elements.title: Did {CmpnName} ever need inpatient, overnight, or emergency care for AP?

elements.name: AspirationInpatientCount
elements.title: How many times did {CmpnName} require inpatient, overnight, or emergency care for AP?

elements.name: AspirationSurgeryPost
elements.title: Did {CmpnName} ever have AP after the surgery (i.e., tieback, BVEAP)?
elements.description: Includes tieback, BVEAP, ventrilocordectomy, arytenoidectomy and other invasive surgery procedures.

elements.name: AspirationSurgeryPostCount
elements.title: How many times did {CmpnName} get AP after the surgery?

elements.name: AspirationStentPost

elements.name: AspirationCost

elements.name: NeuropathyHeading
elements.html: Hind-end weakness and polyneuropathy

elements.name: NeuropathyText
elements.html: This section asks questions about whether {CmpnName} showed symptoms of polyneuropathy and how these symptoms progressed over time.

elements.name: NeuropathyText
elements.html: NOTE: Polyneuropathy refers to the weakening of motor function due to neurological degeneration, particularly in the hind end. Symptoms can include hind-end weakness and incontinence. Younger dogs with idiopathic LP often don't suffer from LP-related polyneuropathy.

elements.name: NeuropathySymptomsDoesHave
elements.title: Over the course of {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP journey, did {CmpnName} experience persistent hind-end weakness?

elements.name: NeuropathySymptomsFirst
elements.title: Which LP/GOLPP symptom appeared first in {CmpnName}?

choices.text: They both appeared at about the same time

elements.name: NeuropathySymptomsBreathingOnset
elements.title: About how long after you first noticed hind-end weakness did the breathing issues begin?

elements.name: NeuropathySymptomsHindEndOnset
elements.title: About now long after you first noticed breathing issues did the hind-end weakness begin?

elements.name: NeuropathySymptomsTypeProgression
elements.title: Which progressed faster, the breathing issues or the hind-end weakness?

choices.text: They both progressed at about the same rate

elements.name: NeuropathyOtherIssues
elements.title: During this time period, did any of these issues also appear?

choices.text: No, {CmpnName} never had any of these issues

elements.name: ConclusionHeading
elements.html: Conclusions

elements.name: Conclusion
elements.html: The final section of this survey asks questions about the last station of {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP journey before {cvGenderSubjectPronoun} crossed over the Rainbow Bridge. If it's too painful to revisit this stage of {CmpnName}'s life, it might be best to discontinue the survey and return to it later.

elements.name: Conclusion
elements.html: This section references questions you asked earlier in the survey to get a picture of how {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP changed over time in relation to other factors that played a role in {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP journey.

elements.name: Conclusion
elements.html: The last survey section asks questions about the current state of {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP. By comparing your answers here to answers you provided earlier, we hope to get a picture of how {cvGenderObjectPronoun} condition changed over time and what factors may have played a role in the LP/GOLPP progression

elements.name: ConclusionIntro
elements.html: IMPORTANT: Please answer the questions about {CmpnName} in his current state of health:

elements.name: ConclusionSpecialConsiderations
elements.title: Please describe any special considerations for {CmpnName} due to LP-related breathing issues:

choices.text: Type, amount or frequency of feeding
Other behavior restrictions i.e., anxiety, excitement

elements.name: ConclusionGeneralCondition
elements.title: Please describe {CmpnName}'s general physical condition:

elements.name: ConclusionQOL
elements.title: How would you rate {CmpnName}'s quality of life at this stage?
elements.description: 1 = very poor, 3 = fair, 5 = very good

elements.name: ConclusionOtherConditions
elements.title: What other conditions {cvDoThirdPersonSingular} {CmpnName} have at this stage?
elements.description: Your selections here will be compared to earlier answers to deterimine which of these conditions developed during {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP journey.

elements.name: ConclusionCauseOfDeathHeading
elements.html: Euthanasia is a humane way to say goodbye when a beloved animal companion has reached end-of-life. This questions asks about the primary cause of {CmpnName}'s passing, not whether humane euthanasia was chosen to help them cross over.

elements.name: ConclusionCauseOfDeath
elements.title: What was the ultimate reason why {CmpnName} crossed over the Rainbow Bridge?

choices.text: Direct post-operative complications of LP surgery or stent implant

elements.name: ConclusionLastQuestionHeading
elements.html: Survey Conclusion

elements.name: ConclusionLastQuestionText
elements.html: LP/GOLPP is a merciless, ruthless disease that forces us to make impossible decisions for our beloved companions. The last question of this survey is speculative. If you were to have another dog with LP, would you choose a different path along their LP/GOLPP journey?

elements.name: ConclusionOtherPathTieback
elements.title: If you were to have another dog with LP/GOLPP under similar circumstances as {CmpnName} what if anything would you differently?

choices.text: I would pursue the same treatment path as with {CmpnName}
I would not do tieback surgery again
I would do tieback surgery sooner than I did with {CmpnName}
I would wait to do tieback surgery longer than I did with {CmpnName}

elements.name: ConclusionOtherPathBVEAP
elements.title: If you were to have another dog with LP/GOLPP under similar circumstances as {CmpnName} what if anything would if anything you differently?

choices.text: I would pursue the same treatment path as with {CmpnName}
I would not do BVEAP surgery again
I would do BVEAP surgery sooner than I did with {CmpnName}
I would wait to do BVEAP surgery longer than I did with {CmpnName}

elements.name: ConclusionOtherPathStent
elements.title: If you were to have another dog with LP/GOLPP under similar circumstances as {CmpnName} what if anything would you differently?

choices.text: I would pursue the same treatment path as with {CmpnName}
I would not do the laryngeal stent implant again
I would do laryngeal stent implant surgery sooner than I did with {CmpnName}
I would wait to do a laryngeal stent implant longer than I did with {CmpnName}

elements.name: ConclusionOtherPathNoSurgery
